# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
function wrap_string(words::AbstractVector, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = IOBuffer()
    current_line_width = 0
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        if current_line_width + word_length > text_width
            println(lines)
            current_line_width = 0
        end
        print(lines, word, " ")
        current_line_width += word_length + 1
    end
    println(lines)
    String(take!(lines))
end
```

And here's an example of using the function:
```julia
julia> words = ["Julia", "is", "a", "high-level", "high-performance", "dynamic", "programming", "language"]
8-element Vector{String}:
 "Julia"
 "is"
 "a"
 "high-level"
 "high-performance"
 "dynamic"
 "programming"
